clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Nutri-jelly on Quality of Life in Head and Neck Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy Study of Nutri-jelly Intake on Quality of Life in Head and Neck Cancer Patients Undergoing Radiotherapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Dental Innovation Foundation Under Royal Patronage

clinical_study.source: Dental Innovation Foundation Under Royal Patronage

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a novel edible nutritious gel for patients with chewing and swallowing difficulties, Nutri-jelly, is effective in improving the quality of life of head and neck cancer patients while undergoing conventional radiotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
- independent variable: continuous Nutri -jelly intake
- dependent variable (outcome): changes in health-related quality of life score

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Health-related quality of life score
primary_outcome.description: Definitive cases: collect data at baseline (0-5), after Nutri-jelly (6-10), 11-15, 16-20, 21-25, 26-30, 31-35 fractions of RT), total period of 6 weeks Palliative cases: collect data at baseline (0-5), after Nutri-jelly (6-10) fractions of RT, total period of 2 weeks

arm_group.description: Continuous intake: orally take 1-3 boxes / day for at least 3 days/ week during radiotherapy
Receive either definitive (total of 30-35 fractions) or palliative ( total of 10 fractions) radiotherapy with no continuous intake of Nutri-Jelly

intervention.description: an edible nutritious gel for chewing and swallowing difficulties 1 box contains 250 ml with 250 kcal 1 serving is considered as food supplement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed as head and neck cancer
- definitive or palliative radiotherapy treatment plan
- can communicate well
Exclusion Criteria:
- bleeding in the mouth
- respiratory distress
- psychiatric disorders
- radiation field not involve masticatory and swallowing apparatus e.g. certain cases of laryngeal cancer and brain cancer
